intro: Anemonospermos aenea, commonly known as the copperleaf anemone, is a striking plant characterized by its vibrant, copper-colored foliage. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant features showy, usually pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, adding to its ornamental appeal. Anemonospermos aenea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a desirable addition to shaded garden landscapes.
